toolstack: CMSs like Wordpress, Forestry, Webflow, Squarespace, HubSpot

experience.text: Working as a freelance front-end developer for a design office based in London, building webpages with Gatsby and React for various customers.
Rebuilding two large websites into custom-made easy-to-use CMSs generated from markdown files, maintaining it.
Working on one project: Rebuilding https://dataintensity.com/ into a static web build with Jekyll & Liquid.
Building the small websites and doing smaller front-end tasks for various customers, mostly taking care of HTML & CSS, workings with various CMSs.

references.title: Sweet City
references.text: A project built in React to promote the upcoming local elections and try to get young people more involved in the process. Implemented markdown files as a way to add new events via github repo.

references.title: Verifa
references.text: A website with blog built in Gatsby with React. Blogging system fed by markdown files via GraphQl

references.title: My portfolio
references.text: My own blog where I can organise my activities and illustartions into different categories. Tagging & blogging system, pagination, shooping cart. Liking feature - likes stored in firebase plus Cart items & like arrays stored in local storage. Also implemented Stripe payment with own Node server hosted on Heroku

references.title: MDM / Minimum Decent Wage
references.text: Built and designed website via wordpress from scratch, Advanced Custom Fields to make it easier to fill in everything. Illustrations.

references.title: Prague suburbs
references.text: Nine chapters about the trasitions that Prague post-soviet suburbs undertook over the years. One page with lots of css & js animations, still in progress + Illustrations

references.title: Fair Migration Politics
references.text: Building a webpage in wordpress on the custom built and designed template; illustrations also done by me

references.title: Movie Search
references.text: one page coded in React where you can search through the online database of movies and display their info, save them as liked or seen into the local browser storage.
